DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Safety Diazepam Management Refractory Epilepsy Selected Patients Who Require Intermittent Medical Intervention Acute Repetitive Seizures .
DOC.criteria: Key Inclusion Criteria For Patient : Older 2 year age 6 136 kg body weight Recipient clinical diagnosis epilepsy , take stable antiepileptic drug regimen least 2 week , require intermittent medical intervention control episodes acute repetitive seizure ( ARS ) Experienced least 2 episode ARS previous year , one occur previous 6 month Has episodes ARS include complex partial generalize seizure Has responsible caregiver available participate Is pregnant lactate practice acceptable method birth control . For Caregiver : Age 18 year older demonstrate responsibility caregiver training : Recognize episode repetitive seizure injection intend , Administer study drug Count record seizures respiratory rate patient diary , Monitor patient record observation patient diary 12 hour follow study drug treatment Recognize need immediate medical attention . Key Exclusion Criteria For Patient : Petit mal status petit mal variant status History ARS consistently progress status epilepticus History failure respond benzodiazepine treatment Hypersensitivity diazepam Acute narrow angle glaucoma Alcohol and/or substance abuse Has take another investigational drug previous 30 day Acute progressive neurologic severe psychiatric disease severe mental abnormality .
